Vulnerabilities: Unrestricted access to server status page

Steps.Description: The attacker recognizes the website as the target and identifies the URL capture service and admin buttons.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that the URL capture service and admin buttons may provide opportunities for unauthorized access or exploitation.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker explores the URL capture service and admin buttons for potential vulnerabilities.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker confirms the presence of a URL capture service and an admin login page.

Steps.Description: The attacker attempts to access the admin login page by trying a common URL, such as http://localhost.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker assumes that the admin login page may be accessible via a common URL, such as http://localhost.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker tries accessing the admin page using the URL http://localhost.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully gains access to the admin login page.

Steps.Description: The attacker checks the robots.txt file and discovers a new path, /server-status.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker speculates that the robots.txt file may contain hidden paths or information.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker views the robots.txt file and finds the path /server-status.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker confirms the existence of the path /server-status.

Steps.Description: The attacker attempts to access the /server-status path and successfully gains access.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the /server-status path may provide information or access to sensitive resources.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker tries accessing the /server-status path.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully accesses the /server-status page.

Steps.Description: The attacker examines the server logs available on the /server-status page and discovers the login credentials.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker expects that the server logs may contain valuable information, such as login credentials.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker reviews the server logs available on the /server-status page.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds the login credentials in the server logs.
